channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @UnnamedDem @JeffreyASachs Will nobody think of the garage elevator installers?

item.description:
@trekonomics @SmithsonianMag “The lion will lie down with the lamb, but the lamb won’t get much sleep,” to quote the sage.

@trekonomics @SmithsonianMag On the other hand, the lamb is less likely to get prion disease.
item.source:markdown:

item.description:
@trekonomics Instead of Longtermism, we need Zeydeism — how can we make the best future for our grandchildren and their peers 75 years hence?

@trekonomics The flip side is that the whole enlightenment project of working toward a better future is only three or four centuries old. So the potential for improvement in the next century is actually rather big.
item.source:markdown:
@trekonomics Instead of Longtermism, we need Zeydeism — how can we make the best future for our grandchildren and their peers 75 years hence?
@trekonomics The flip side is that the whole enlightenment project of working toward a better future is only three or four centuries old. So the potential for improvement in the next century is actually rather big.

item.description:
@trekonomics Well, African rates are trending down too. The hubris is thinking that that we are better positioned to solve the problems of a century hence than our descendants are.

@trekonomics One of the dangers of overvaluing the unborn, so a planet which settles into a stable 7 billion people is worse than one that settles at 10 billion.
item.source:markdown:
@trekonomics Well, African rates are trending down too. The hubris is thinking that that we are better positioned to solve the problems of a century hence than our descendants are.
@trekonomics One of the dangers of overvaluing the unborn, so a planet which settles into a stable 7 billion people is worse than one that settles at 10 billion.

item.description: @protecttruth_ I would say this is good news. “Rogue courts want to arm Texas teens against will of Republican legislature” is a better slogan than “Rogue Court wants to disempower the EPA”
item.source:markdown: @protecttruth_ I would say this is good news. “Rogue courts want to arm Texas teens against will of Republican legislature” is a better slogan than “Rogue Court wants to disempower the EPA”

item.description:
@trekonomics Given that most of my ancestors were (presumably) eaten by worms, it seems only fair.

@trekonomics (Two of my great grandparents, pictured posthumously here on the left, being among the exceptions.) https://t.co/x040C4mzfM

item.description:
@nberlat People are not used to the fine print making govt policies look better.

@nberlat Starting to think the administration is legit playing chess these days, against Team R who can barely manage checkers.

@nberlat Note that unlike most efforts at “centrism,” the administration accepts the left frame that student debt is unfair and is sniping at the right.

@onthemainline Arguably simpler than remembering to reverse all the pages in your PDF — which can be done either by installing a script into Adobe Acrobat or printing the file as a PDF with pages reversed.
item.source:markdown: @onthemainline Arguably simpler than remembering to reverse all the pages in your PDF — which can be done either by installing a script into Adobe Acrobat or printing the file as a PDF with pages reversed.

item.description: @ZacharyBraiterm This is the only report I have seen on the alleged ties — which seem to boil down to coerced hearsay testimony and guilt by association. https://t.co/4UkN6GUV23
item.source:markdown: @ZacharyBraiterm This is the only report I have seen on the alleged ties — which seem to boil down to coerced hearsay testimony and guilt by association. https://t.co/4UkN6GUV23

item.description:
Thinking about the loan forgiveness rollout. They leaked the $10k amount well in advance — front loading complaints it wasn’t enough. They buried more consequential relief in the fine print. And now they’re dunking on their Republican critics — not on the left.

I think they’ve deliberately moved the Overton Window to the left.

That’s not something I recall much of from recent Dem administrations.
item.source:markdown:
Thinking about the loan forgiveness rollout. They leaked the $10k amount well in advance — front loading complaints it wasn’t enough. They buried more consequential relief in the fine print. And now they’re dunking on their Republican critics — not on the left.
I think they’ve deliberately moved the Overton Window to the left.
That’s not something I recall much of from recent Dem administrations.

item.description: @trekonomics I suspect that we have hit peak free-form criminality. Either we have a return to the rule of law or a more politicized criminality that will be far less lucrative to independent ne’er do wells.

item.description: @trekonomics Actually, knowing that he has a supervillain past makes his frightening rise much more explicable.
item.source:markdown: @trekonomics Actually, knowing that he has a supervillain past makes his frightening rise much more explicable.

item.description:
What do you know. The Hero of Tikvah Fund has his own supervillain back story! https://t.co/b5hEbitQ9a

Looking forward to Tikvah teaching teens why the Torah is a more moral force for waging war than the Geneva Conventions.

item.description: @sillyhead @maimonides_nutz I’ve been told by generally reliable sources that “girls go to college to get more knowledge. Boys go to Jupiter to get more stupider.” So I’m hedging my bets.

item.description:
“I was afraid that my daughter would grow up in a school that is a kind of ghetto, only for asylum seekers,” Marhtsion explains. “I asked myself – why shouldn’t my daughter study together with other Israeli children?” https://t.co/LRM3yKLUVW

“I am a believing Christian, and when I studied in college I organized joint prayers for women, even though such prayers were prohibited by law.” — One can see why the Israeli government wouldn’t want people like her. Christians are one thing; woman’s prayer groups are treif.

“It hurts me to leave,” she repeats, “I got to know the Israelis deeply. Most of the public wants us and lives with us in peace, but because of politicians and a handful of racists, our lives look the terrible way they do.”

(It’s worth noting the ways the institutions of the American Jewish community prioritize relations with the politicians, rather than the people.)

“The people I met where I worked always took care of me and helped me grow. It pains me that I couldn’t continue living in Israel, but it’s a shame that the country, with all its history, closes its heart to refugees.”
item.source:markdown:
“I was afraid that my daughter would grow up in a school that is a kind of ghetto, only for asylum seekers,” Marhtsion explains. “I asked myself – why shouldn’t my daughter study together with other Israeli children?” https://t.co/LRM3yKLUVW
“I am a believing Christian, and when I studied in college I organized joint prayers for women, even though such prayers were prohibited by law.” — One can see why the Israeli government wouldn’t want people like her. Christians are one thing; woman’s prayer groups are treif.
“It hurts me to leave,” she repeats, “I got to know the Israelis deeply. Most of the public wants us and lives with us in peace, but because of politicians and a handful of racists, our lives look the terrible way they do.”
(It’s worth noting the ways the institutions of the American Jewish community prioritize relations with the politicians, rather than the people.)
“The people I met where I worked always took care of me and helped me grow. It pains me that I couldn’t continue living in Israel, but it’s a shame that the country, with all its history, closes its heart to refugees.”
